revised_title: Weather Journal of Montreal: Observations of Temperature, Snowfall, and Wind Patterns
tldr: This article presents a detailed weather journal of Montreal from December 1776 to March 1777, documenting daily temperature readings, snowfall amounts, and wind patterns. The author, Mr. Barr, observes that the winter was relatively mild, with the lowest temperature recorded at 50 degrees Fahrenheit below zero. The wind never blew from the north during the author's time in America.
